results.clause_text: This document is a Service Level Agreement between Northwestern IT (service provider) and the (customer), outlining the provisioning of IT services. The purpose of this agreement is to establish service expectations, identify provider and consumer responsibilities related to this service, specify how this service is supported, and clarify service charges.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: The primary business risk if this clause is ignored (i.e., not included) is a loss of foundational clarity for the Service Level Agreement, as the document would lack an explicit statement of its overarching purpose and the general areas it intends to address. While this would affect the agreement's structure and readability, the direct operational or financial exposure associated with the absence of this purely declarative statement is minimal. Significant business risks arise only if the substantive, operative sections of the agreement subsequently fail to define the specific service expectations, responsibilities, support, and charges that this introductory clause promises to cover.
results.suggested_correction: This document is a Service Level Agreement between Northwestern IT (service provider) and the (customer), outlining the provisioning of IT services. The purpose of this agreement is to establish service expectations, identify provider and consumer responsibilities related to this service, specify how this service is supported, and clarify service charges.
results.justification: This clause functions as an introductory purpose statement for the Service Level Agreement. It explicitly states its purpose is 'outlining' and 'to establish' general areas such as service expectations, responsibilities, support, and charges. This declarative nature means it does not define specific operative terms, measurable performance standards, or detailed scopes of services, which are typically found in substantive golden clauses like 'Service Levels' or 'Scope of Services'. As such, the clause does not fit any specific golden clause type that dictates measurable obligations or detailed provisions. The clause itself is purely descriptive and sets the stage for the agreement's content, rather than imposing direct legal obligations or defining enforceable terms. Consequently, it carries minimal inherent legal enforceability risk or commercial exposure. The potential for risk lies not within the drafting of this specific clause, but rather in the broader agreement failing to subsequently define the details (e.g., specific service levels, detailed responsibilities, clear charges) that this introductory statement promises to cover. For this particular clause, its benign nature as an introductory statement results in a very low inherent risk.

results.clause_text: Northwestern IT (NUIT) agrees to provide Endpoint device management and support as a service to customer. NUIT will: provide • Device deployment – Procurement, Custom factory image loading including enterprise licensed common applications, asset tagging and labelling, pre-delivery and staging services, and system installation, system configuration and data migrations. Delivers and installs your fully integrated systems to customer designated user locations. • Secure endpoint management - pre-configuration of security solutions and installation of antivirus, data encryption and data backup solutions. Regular application of Operating system and application software patches. • Device Management - Agent monitoring to ensure proper tracking of device lifecycle • NUIT Service Desk - represents the entry point and first-touch support process for all hardware and software service-related requests. NUIT delivers a strategic, customized full-featured service desk that is driven by the goals of quality, value, and customer satisfaction. NUIT service desk is accountable to resolve, track, escalate and follow-up on all Endpoint systems related issues that affect customer productivity. • NUIT provides on-site Field Services support for endpoint systems, software, and peripherals support. We assist with installations, moves, adds and changes, as well as everyday hardware and peripheral support services. Authorized service delivery providers will be dispatched to your End User when hardware, software, or peripheral problems cannot be resolved remotely. • Disposition and redeployment– NUIT delivers efficient, secure and simple processes for data recoveries to disposals and refreshes. Ensures that system data is destroyed for security purposes. Disposal of Assets and manages Employee Purchase Programs.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: If ignored, NUIT faces potential 'scope creep' where customers expect additional services without explicit agreement or compensation, leading to unbudgeted costs, resource strain, and operational inefficiencies. The absence of clearly defined customer responsibilities can hinder NUIT's ability to deliver services efficiently, causing delays and disputes when NUIT requires customer input, access, or approvals. Without a formal change control mechanism, modifications to service scope could become a source of contention, impacting project timelines, client satisfaction, and financial forecasts, and potentially leading to legal disputes over performance and payment.
results.suggested_correction:
Northwestern IT (NUIT) agrees to provide Endpoint device management and support as a service to customer. NUIT shall perform the following services:
- Device deployment: NUIT shall procure, custom factory image load (including enterprise licensed common applications), asset tag and label, provide pre-delivery and staging services, and perform system installation, system configuration and data migrations. NUIT shall deliver and install fully integrated systems to customer-designated user locations.
- Secure endpoint management: NUIT shall pre-configure security solutions and install antivirus, data encryption and data backup solutions, and shall regularly apply Operating system and application software patches.
- Device Management: NUIT shall provide Agent monitoring to ensure proper tracking of device lifecycle.
- NUIT Service Desk: NUIT shall provide a strategic, customized full-featured service desk that acts as the entry point and first-touch support for all hardware and software service-related requests, driven by the goals of quality, value, and customer satisfaction. NUIT shall be accountable to resolve, track, escalate and follow-up on all Endpoint systems related issues that affect customer productivity.
- On-site Field Services support: NUIT shall provide on-site Field Services support for endpoint systems, software, and peripherals, including assistance with installations, moves, adds and changes, as well as everyday hardware and peripheral support services. Authorized service delivery providers shall be dispatched to Customer's End User when hardware, software, or peripheral problems cannot be resolved remotely.
- Disposition and redeployment: NUIT shall deliver efficient, secure and simple processes for data recoveries to disposals and refreshes, ensure that system data is destroyed for security purposes, dispose of Assets, and manage Employee Purchase Programs.
Customer shall provide NUIT with timely access to its premises, systems, data, and personnel as reasonably required for NUIT to perform the Services, and shall cooperate in good faith with NUIT in the performance of the Services. Any services requested by Customer that fall outside the scope of services described herein, or any material modifications to these services, shall be subject to a mutually agreed written change order, which shall include any adjustments to fees and timelines.
results.justification: The clause comprehensively describes the services NUIT is obliged to provide, aligning it with a 'Scope of Services' classification. However, a significant imbalance exists because the clause entirely omits reciprocal customer responsibilities essential for NUIT's effective performance. For instance, customer obligations regarding access, information, or cooperation are undefined, creating a unilateral burden on NUIT. Furthermore, the clause lacks any mechanism for managing changes to the scope of services, which is a critical omission for any ongoing service agreement. This absence opens NUIT to significant commercial and operational exposure, including potential scope creep where additional services are implicitly expected without formal agreement or compensation, leading to unbudgeted costs and resource strain. Disputes regarding the scope of work, delays in service delivery due to lack of customer cooperation, and challenges in modifying service parameters without a clear process are significant enforceability risks. Therefore, despite the clarity in defining NUIT's specific tasks, the fundamental imbalance and absence of crucial contractual mechanisms elevate the risk to a moderate level, reflecting the potential for significant operational disruptions, financial implications, and contractual disagreements.

results.clause_text: The period of this agreement is September 1, 2019 through August 30, 2020. Each year, this agreement will automatically extend for one calendar year unless it is modified or terminated as described in this document.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: Ignoring the current drafting poses a moderate business risk primarily due to the automatic renewal mechanism and the vague reference to external termination provisions. The primary commercial exposure arises from the potential for an unwanted extension of the agreement, leading to unforeseen financial obligations and continued commitment to a potentially suboptimal arrangement. This risk is heightened by the absence of a specific notice period for non-renewal within the clause itself, creating a significant operational burden on parties to diligently track renewal dates and locate the relevant termination procedures elsewhere in the document. Failure to provide timely notice could result in contractual obligations persisting beyond the desired period, impacting budgeting, strategic planning, and vendor management.
results.suggested_correction: The initial term of this agreement shall commence on September 1, 2019 and end on August 30, 2020. Thereafter, this agreement shall automatically extend for successive one-year periods unless either party provides written notice of non-renewal to the other party at least 60 days prior to the end of the then-current term.
results.justification: This clause is identified as a Term and Termination clause, defining the initial duration and specifying an automatic annual renewal. While the initial term is clear, the mechanism for modification or termination, particularly non-renewal, poses a moderate risk. The phrase 'unless it is modified or terminated as described in this document' defers critical procedural details, such as notice periods for non-renewal, to other parts of the agreement. This deferral creates a significant operational and commercial exposure. Parties bear the onus of proactively tracking renewal dates and seeking out termination provisions elsewhere, increasing the potential for oversight. Should a party fail to provide timely notice of non-renewal, they face an unwanted extension of the agreement, leading to unanticipated financial obligations and continued contractual commitment. While the clause itself is enforceable regarding its automatic renewal, the lack of an explicit, self-contained notice period for non-renewal within this provision introduces ambiguity and elevates the risk of inadvertent renewal. The reconciled risk score of 5.0 reflects this moderate ambiguity and the potential for commercial and operational exposure arising from the procedural burden and oversight risk associated with the automatic renewal and deferred termination details.

results.clause_text: Maintenance of services provided in this agreement will be conducted in accordance with established NUIT Change Management practices, and will occur during scheduled service maintenance windows. Emergency maintenance, in response to service outages, may occur with no advanced notice to service consumers. Maintenance or outages of other, underlying or integrated, services may impact the services provided in this agreement. Notification of service maintenance and outages is available at: Service Status (https://service-status.northwestern.edu/). Information on how to subscribe to email service alerts can be found at: https://service-status.northwestern.edu/
results.justification: All models agree this clause is not a golden clause.

results.clause_text: The following list specifies responsibilities of NUIT related to providing the service set forth in this agreement. Northwestern IT will be responsible for the following: Workstations (desktop and laptop computers) • Build workstations Install one of NUIT approved computer images o  Dual booting or machines with multiple operating systems will be assessed and approved by the Technology Support Services Director on a case by case basis based on business, research or teaching need. Install additional software and or make additional updates to the endpoint device o  Upon request  Subject to security approval Include and manage o  NUIT’ service automated software updating services (Kace/ JAMF)  Endpoint security software(Symantec Endpoint Protection)  Whole disk encryption (MBAM and FileVault) Ensure desired work space has functional electrical and network access o  Make recommendations for electrical or network access and advise CONDUITS and FM ordering processes. Purchase, deliver and install workstation in desired work space o Troubleshooting wired or wireless network connectivity users, escalating to TNS has required. o • Address user observed errors upon notification Conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts o Coordinate warranty work as required o  Coordinate with Dell, Lenovo/CDWG for services (PCs)  Coordinate with Apple service technician (MACs) Provide temporary loaner computer o  Upon request  If operationally necessary  Subject to availability Conference room and classroom support o  Coordinate with Northwestern IT Audio/Visual team as need for support issue • Provide departmental fiscal office with semi-annual refresh notifications for workstations. • Assist with providing purchasing recommendations for new or replacement computers • Provide major OS updates as required for vendor support (e.g. Windows “Creator Updates”, MacOS 10.X point releases) • Provide disposition of end-of-life devices Scrub data and remove hard drive o Send devices to Northwestern University Surplus and/or donate to Student Enrichment Services Mobile Devices The following support is offered upon request: • Make purchasing recommendations for Northwestern University owned mobile device • Configure mobile devise • Configure email • Coordinate activities with 3rd party vendors as required (University owned devices only) • Address user observed errors upon notification Conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts o Coordinate warranty work as required (University owned devices only) o Printers The following support is offered upon request: • Set up printers • Organize for disposal of printers OU Administration (CampusAD) The following support is offered upon request: • Add new users to CampusAD • Create CampusAD accounts • Grant access to resources control via CampusAD • Delete users • Manage Group Policies Endpoint Management Services Management of the following endpoint management software’s: • Workstations will be patched no less than monthly for OS and application by use of management software, including Kace, JAMF • Full system backup of device including local machine stored data using Crashplan Monitoring of backup services will be provided, with either tickets generated o or user notification provided in the event that backups are not functioning Box The following support is offered upon request: • Install Box client software, such as Box Edit, Drive and Sync • Facilitate the creation of organization shares and group accounts Multi-function devices The following support is offered upon request: • Configure printing and scanning access to a multi-function device. • Address user observed errors upon notification Conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts o Coordinate warranty work as required o Installation and Troubleshooting of customer specific software The following support is offered upon request: • Northwestern IT will install all customer specific software and will work with the user/experts in said software to ensure that the installation of these applications does not destabilize other desktop or application functionality • NUIT will work with the user/experts to contact the vendor of said software to accomplish same, but will not act independently of the user/experts in contacting vendors. Out of Scope The following services are explicitly not offered in this SLA. • Management of personal devices • Support for unmanaged devices such as servers, customer purchased devices New Technology Both Northwestern IT and the customer recognize that new technology adoption is important to the mission of the university. The customer may be introduced or considered for adoption during the course of this Agreement. At the mutual agreement of the NUIT and the customer, joint testing, demonstration, or evaluation of such technology may be undertaken. If the customer adopts a new computing technology and desires that NUIT support it, then the Customer Contact will consult with the TSS. If they agree that the new technology has a limited effect on support time for the support personnel, then it will be incorporated into the current support activities. Otherwise, the Customer Contact will follow the procedure described in the section entitled “Support Outside of this Agreement”. Computer Support Policies Northwestern IT will support the University-owned computers of the customer based on the following policies: 1. New purchases must meet the Northwestern IT recommended standards. New purchases will be set up with the NUIT software image. 2. Existing computer hardware must meet the minimum hardware and operating system standards. 3. Support level will be determined by the age of the machine Computer Age Support level Support description 0-4 years Full Support Northwestern IT will ensure the working order of the computer, using reasonable staff time and support resources 4-5 years Best Effort Northwestern IT will spend up to one hour fixing an issue. If the issue cannot be resolved at that time, NUIT will recommend replacing the computer and facilitate the recovery/transfer of data. 5 years or Out of Support Northwestern IT will facilitate the recovery/transfer of older data, but will not attempt to resolve technical issues. Legacy Computers connected to instruments • Best effort support will be provided to computers connected to research equipment in consultation with Northwestern IT’s Information Security Office • Legacy equipment may need to be placed off network to avoid remote exploit or other risk
results.business_risk_if_ignored: Ignoring the identified weaknesses in this clause would expose customers to significant operational and financial risks, primarily due to NUIT's broad discretion and unilateral imposition of service limitations. Customers could face unexpected costs for early hardware replacement, service disruptions for older or specialized equipment, and hindrances to adopting new technologies. The frequent conditioning of support on NUIT's discretion ('subject to security approval', 'if operationally necessary', 'subject to availability') creates ambiguity regarding service entitlements and increases the likelihood of service level disputes or unfulfilled support needs. Furthermore, the 'Best Effort' limitations and 'Out of Support' policies for aging equipment directly transfer the burden of technology refresh and associated costs to the customer, impacting budget planning and operational continuity.
results.suggested_correction: The following list specifies responsibilities of NUIT related to providing the service set forth in this agreement. Northwestern IT shall be responsible for the following: Workstations (desktop and laptop computers) • Build workstations: NUIT shall install one of NUIT approved computer images. Dual booting or machines with multiple operating systems will be assessed and approved by the Technology Support Services Director on a case-by-case basis based on business, research or teaching need. NUIT shall install additional software or make additional updates to endpoint devices upon customer request, subject to NUIT's standard security approval processes and policies. NUIT shall include and manage automated software updating services (Kace/JAMF), endpoint security software (Symantec Endpoint Protection), and whole disk encryption (MBAM and FileVault). NUIT shall ensure the desired workspace has functional electrical and network access, make recommendations for electrical or network access, and advise CONDUITS and FM ordering processes. NUIT shall purchase, deliver, and install workstations in the desired workspace. NUIT shall provide troubleshooting for wired or wireless network connectivity issues for users, escalating to TNS as required. NUIT shall address user-observed errors upon notification and conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts. NUIT shall coordinate warranty work as required, including coordination with Dell, Lenovo/CDWG for PCs, and with Apple service technicians for MACs. NUIT shall provide temporary loaner computers upon request, subject to operational necessity and availability, and NUIT shall define and maintain reasonable criteria for such operational necessity and availability. NUIT shall provide conference room and classroom support, coordinating with the Northwestern IT Audio/Visual team as needed for support issues. • NUIT shall provide the departmental fiscal office with semi-annual refresh notifications for workstations. • NUIT shall assist with providing purchasing recommendations for new or replacement computers. • NUIT shall provide major OS updates as required for vendor support (e.g., Windows “Creator Updates”, MacOS 10.X point releases). • NUIT shall provide disposition of end-of-life devices by scrubbing data, removing hard drives, and sending devices to Northwestern University Surplus and/or donating to Student Enrichment Services. Mobile Devices The following support is offered upon request: • NUIT shall make purchasing recommendations for Northwestern University-owned mobile devices. • NUIT shall configure mobile devices. • NUIT shall configure email. • NUIT shall coordinate activities with third-party vendors as required (University-owned devices only). • NUIT shall address user-observed errors upon notification, conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts, and coordinate warranty work as required (University-owned devices only). Printers The following support is offered upon request: • NUIT shall set up printers. • NUIT shall organize for disposal of printers. OU Administration (CampusAD) The following support is offered upon request: • NUIT shall add new users to CampusAD. • NUIT shall create CampusAD accounts. • NUIT shall grant access to resources control via CampusAD. • NUIT shall delete users. • NUIT shall manage Group Policies. Endpoint Management Services NUIT shall manage the following endpoint management software: • Workstations shall be patched no less than monthly for OS and applications by use of management software, including Kace, JAMF. • Full system backup of devices, including local machine stored data, shall be performed using Crashplan. Monitoring of backup services shall be provided, with either tickets generated or user notification provided in the event that backups are not functioning. Box The following support is offered upon request: • NUIT shall install Box client software, such as Box Edit, Drive and Sync. • NUIT shall facilitate the creation of organization shares and group accounts. Multi-function devices The following support is offered upon request: • NUIT shall configure printing and scanning access to a multi-function device. • NUIT shall address user-observed errors upon notification, conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts, and coordinate warranty work as required. Installation and Troubleshooting of customer-specific software The following support is offered upon request: • Northwestern IT shall install all customer-specific software and shall work with the user/experts in said software to ensure that the installation of these applications does not destabilize other desktop or application functionality. • NUIT shall work with the user/experts to contact the vendor of said software to accomplish same, but shall not act independently of the user/experts in contacting vendors. Out of Scope The following services are explicitly not offered in this SLA: • Management of personal devices. • Support for unmanaged devices such as servers or customer purchased devices. New Technology Both Northwestern IT and the customer recognize the importance of adopting new technology for the university's mission. Should a customer desire NUIT to support new computing technology, the Customer Contact shall consult with NUIT's Technology Support Services. NUIT shall evaluate the new technology's impact on support time and resources. If NUIT determines that the new technology can be supported within existing service parameters or with mutually agreed adjustments, it shall be incorporated into current support activities. Otherwise, support for such technology shall be governed by the procedure described in the section entitled “Support Outside of this Agreement.” Computer Support Policies Northwestern IT shall support the University-owned computers of the customer based on the following standard policies, which NUIT reserves the right to update periodically upon reasonable notice to customers. NUIT shall review and consult with customers on potential exceptions for critical systems: 1. New purchases must meet Northwestern IT recommended standards. New purchases will be set up with the NUIT software image. 2. Existing computer hardware must meet the minimum hardware and operating system standards. 3. Support level will be determined by the age of the machine. Computer Age Support level Support description: 0-4 years Full Support: Northwestern IT shall ensure the working order of the computer, using reasonable staff time and support resources. 4-5 years Best Effort: Northwestern IT shall spend up to one hour fixing an issue. If the issue cannot be resolved at that time, NUIT shall recommend replacing the computer and facilitate the recovery/transfer of data. This best effort support shall apply to computers connected to research equipment in consultation with Northwestern IT’s Information Security Office, with efforts not exceeding the standard one-hour limit unless otherwise agreed for critical research systems. 5 years or older Out of Support: Northwestern IT shall facilitate the recovery/transfer of older data, but shall not attempt to resolve technical issues. Legacy equipment connected to research instruments may require placement off-network, as determined by NUIT's Information Security Office, to mitigate identified security risks. NUIT shall consult with the customer regarding such requirements.
results.justification: This clause is correctly classified as a 'Scope of Services' as it comprehensively details the IT services NUIT provides, including specifics for workstations, mobile devices, printers, and various support functions, alongside an explicit 'Out of Scope' section. While beneficial for clarity, the clause demonstrates a significant imbalance of obligations, primarily favoring NUIT, which elevates its risk profile to moderate. Many of NUIT's stated responsibilities are conditioned on subjective criteria or NUIT's sole discretion, such as 'subject to security approval,' 'if operationally necessary,' and 'subject to availability.' These conditions introduce ambiguity and provide NUIT with considerable latitude to limit its performance, potentially leading to disputes over service provision and creating commercial exposure for customers reliant on these services. Furthermore, the 'Computer Support Policies' unilaterally impose strict age-based limitations on support, including a 'Best Effort' period capped at one hour for 4-5 year old machines and 'Out of Support' for devices 5 years or older. This policy effectively transfers the financial and operational burden of timely hardware refresh to the customer, irrespective of their specific needs or budget cycles. Similarly, the process for 'New Technology' adoption grants NUIT significant control over whether new solutions will be supported, potentially hindering customer innovation. The clause's overall structure, with extensive disclaimers and limitations on NUIT's part without clear reciprocal obligations or mechanisms for customer redress, contributes to its imbalance. The reconciled risk score of 5.5 reflects that while the clause provides a clear framework for services, the numerous qualifications, limitations of liability, and unilateral support policies create material operational and financial risks for the customer, warranting a position at the higher end of the moderate risk spectrum.

results.clause_text: The following list contains the customer’s responsibilities related to their use of this service: General • Submit requests for services to the IT Support Center (by email, phone, or self-service ticket entry) • Submit notification of service interruptions or reductions to the IT Support Center • Provide funding for the purchase of any equipment covered by this SLA • Provide a list of the devices and their serial numbers for each device covered by this SLA: Initial list will be provided from Kace export o Updates and changes to support environment will be managed in Kace, or its replacement for asset management • Notify NUIT of devices to be added to the SLA throughout the year through the new computer request form Workstations • Arrange to refresh workstations within four years of purchase • Provide funding for the refresh purchase Printers • Purchase a service warranty for each University owned printer that includes break-fix and full replacement
results.business_risk_if_ignored: If this clause remains uncorrected, the customer faces significant financial exposure due to the explicit obligations to fund equipment purchases, workstation refreshes, and printer warranties without clear reciprocal commitments or service levels from the provider. This imbalance creates a risk of disputes over performance, potentially leading to cost overruns or diminished value received if the service provider's performance does not meet expectations, as the customer's duties are clearly defined but the provider's are not within this specific clause. Operationally, it could lead to disagreements on the prerequisites for service delivery and a lack of clear accountability if service issues arise.
results.suggested_correction: Customer Responsibilities. The Customer shall be responsible for the following obligations related to its use of the Service: (a) General: The Customer shall submit requests for services to the IT Support Center (by email, phone, or self-service ticket entry); submit notification of service interruptions or reductions to the IT Support Center; provide funding for the purchase of any equipment covered by this SLA; provide an initial list of the devices and their serial numbers for each device covered by this SLA (from Kace export) and manage updates and changes to the support environment in Kace or its replacement for asset management; and notify NUIT of devices to be added to the SLA throughout the year through the new computer request form. (b) Workstations: The Customer shall arrange to refresh workstations within four years of purchase and provide funding for such refresh purchase. (c) Printers: The Customer shall purchase a service warranty for each University owned printer that includes break-fix and full replacement.
results.justification: This clause is categorized as a Scope of Services clause because it explicitly outlines the customer's responsibilities related to the use of the service, which directly relates to party responsibilities for performance within a service agreement context. The primary risk identified is the inherent imbalance of obligations, as the clause exclusively details the customer's duties without corresponding reciprocal obligations or service level commitments from the provider. While the customer's responsibilities themselves are clearly articulated, the absence of an accompanying framework for the provider's performance or consequences for non-compliance creates a moderate legal and commercial risk. The customer is obligated to perform various actions, including significant financial outlays for equipment, refreshes, and warranties, without clear assurance or remedies concerning the service provider's delivery. This one-sidedness can lead to potential disputes regarding the conditions for service provision, leaving the customer vulnerable to assuming costs and responsibilities without clear reciprocal value. The reconciled risk score of 5.0 reflects this moderate exposure, acknowledging that while the clause is clear about what the customer must do, the imbalance creates an enforceability weakness in terms of overall contractual fairness and potential for commercial disputes if provider performance is not addressed adequately in other sections of the agreement. The lack of legally operative language also makes the current phrasing less definitive for binding contractual obligations.

results.clause_text: This service agreement assumes the following: • NUIT will bill Customer for support activity outside of the scope of this agreement at a standard service rate • Overtime work will be charged at 150% of the standard rate • After hours support work that requires support personal to return to work will include a minimum charge of three hours
results.business_risk_if_ignored: Ignoring the current drafting will expose the Customer to unbudgeted cost overruns and potential disputes regarding the application and calculation of additional charges. The lack of clarity around what constitutes 'outside the scope' activities and the undefined 'standard service rate' creates significant financial uncertainty and a high likelihood of disagreement over invoices, potentially damaging the commercial relationship and incurring legal costs to resolve.
results.suggested_correction: NUIT shall bill Customer for any support activity performed outside the scope of services defined in this Agreement at NUIT's then-current standard service rate. Overtime work shall be charged at 150% of the standard service rate. After-hours support work requiring NUIT personnel to return to work shall include a minimum charge equivalent to three hours at the standard service rate.
results.justification: The clause, which outlines billing practices for services beyond the primary scope, including specific charges for overtime and after-hours work, is a clear instance of Payment Terms. The primary enforceability risk stems from the ambiguous definition of 'support activity outside of the scope of this agreement' and the complete lack of definition for 'standard service rate'. Without these essential parameters, the Customer cannot ascertain the true cost implications of such services, leading to potential disputes over what activities are chargeable and at what rate. The clause is significantly imbalanced as it imposes various additional charges on the Customer without corresponding clarity or reciprocal obligations, focusing entirely on the provider's ability to bill extra. This imbalance, combined with the material ambiguity, creates significant commercial exposure for the Customer in the form of unpredictable and potentially substantial cost increases for services that may be deemed 'out-of-scope' or performed during non-standard hours, thereby justifying a moderate-to-high risk score due to its potential for conflict and unbudgeted expenditure.

results.clause_text: Support tickets, pertaining to service incidents (break-fix) and requests, should be submitted via the NUIT Service Desk and include the following information: • Customer contact information including: name, phone number, email address • Brief description of the service issue • Priority level of the incident or request The Service Desk staff will provide first level support to resolve the issue. Issues that are not resolved at first level will be escalated to Tier 2 support teams for resolution. Telephone calls received by the Service Desk outside of scheduled support hours will prompt callers to leave a message or page support staff for emergencies. The voice messages will be responded to on next business day. Customers are encouraged to check the NUIT Service Status web site https://service-status.northwestern.edu/ for scheduled maintenance events and service alerts. Hours Contact Information Days of operation Monday – 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM Phone: (847) 491-4357 Friday (1-HELP) Service Desk https://www.it.northwestern.edu/supportcenter/index.html Saturday Not Available Sunday Not Available Summer Hours Monday – Friday 8:00 am – 5:00pm CLOSED: Winter/Spring Break, University holidays
results.business_risk_if_ignored: Ignoring the current drafting weaknesses creates significant business exposure due to the absence of clear, measurable service level commitments from the provider. While the customer is obligated to follow specific submission procedures and provide a priority level, the provider's corresponding performance is not quantitatively defined or enforceable beyond general operational hours and a 'next business day' response for voicemails. This imbalance can lead to customer dissatisfaction, disputes over service quality and timeliness, and a lack of contractual recourse for slow or ineffective support. Unmanaged expectations regarding resolution times, especially for issues with an assigned 'Priority level', could result in service failures impacting critical business operations without clear accountability or a mechanism for redress.
results.suggested_correction: Support tickets for service incidents (break-fix) and requests shall be submitted via the NUIT Service Desk and must include: customer contact information (name, phone number, email address); a brief description of the service issue; and the priority level of the incident or request. The Service Desk staff shall provide first-level support and shall endeavor to resolve issues consistent with the assigned priority level. Issues not resolved at the first level shall be escalated to Tier 2 support teams for resolution. Telephone calls received by the Service Desk outside of scheduled support hours shall prompt callers to leave a message. Such voice messages shall be responded to on the next business day. Customers are encouraged to check the NUIT Service Status web site for scheduled maintenance events and service alerts. The NUIT Service Desk operates Monday through Friday, 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, except during Summer Hours (Monday – Friday, 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM). The Service Desk is closed on Saturdays, Sundays, Winter/Spring Break, and University holidays. Contact for the Service Desk is Phone: (847) 491-4357 (1-HELP) or via its web site: https://www.it.northwestern.edu/supportcenter/index.html.
results.justification: This clause, despite its descriptive tone, fundamentally defines aspects of service delivery, including how support is accessed, initial support processes, escalation paths, and operational availability. These elements directly align with the characteristics of a 'Service Levels' clause. The primary enforceability risk stems from the significant imbalance of obligations: while the customer is explicitly required to provide detailed information and a priority level for incidents, the provider's corresponding performance commitments for resolution are notably absent. The clause specifies operational hours and a 'next business day' response for voicemails, but it lacks specific, measurable Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for incident response and resolution times, particularly those linked to the customer's stated 'Priority level'. This creates substantial commercial exposure, as the customer has limited contractual recourse or defined expectations if support is delayed or ineffective, potentially leading to disputes over service quality rather than clear accountability. The clause's current phrasing uses 'will' for provider actions, which is descriptive, rather than 'shall', which denotes an obligation. This ambiguity regarding the binding nature of the provider's actions, coupled with the absence of quantifiable service targets and any stated remedies for failure to meet implicit or explicit commitments, results in a moderate risk score of 6.5. This score reflects significant enforceability gaps and an imbalance of obligations, leaving the customer vulnerable to undefined service quality despite their clear procedural requirements.

results.clause_text: All incident tickets are assessed for customer impact and urgency to determine priority. A predefined Incident priority matrix is used as guidance in assessing incident priority. Priority Target Target Response Resolution Time Time Critical Immediate 2 Hour (P1) High 15 Minutes 8 Hours (P2) Medium 15 Minutes 24 Hours (P3) Low 4 Business 3 Business Days (P4) Hours NUIT aims to meet these targets 80% or more over a period of calendar month. ** We expect to provide a 15-minute response time and 2-hour target resolution time for all incidents or requests received from deans, director and chairs, and their designated assistants with a 90% of higher compliance target.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: If this clause is ignored, the service recipient faces significant operational and financial exposure. The service provider's commitments regarding incident response and resolution times, including specific targets for high-priority stakeholders, are expressed using aspirational language ('aims to meet', 'expect to provide') rather than binding contractual obligations. Furthermore, the clause entirely lacks any provisions for remedies, service credits, or penalties in the event these targets are not met. Consequently, the service recipient would have no contractual recourse to enforce performance or seek compensation for failures, leading to potential service disruptions, unaddressed IT issues, and an inability to hold the provider accountable for the stated service levels.
results.suggested_correction: All incident tickets are assessed for customer impact and urgency to determine priority. A predefined Incident priority matrix is used as guidance in assessing incident priority. Priority Target Target Response Resolution Time Time Critical Immediate 2 Hour (P1) High 15 Minutes 8 Hours (P2) Medium 15 Minutes 24 Hours (P3) Low 4 Business 3 Business Days (P4) Hours NUIT shall meet these targets at a rate of 80% or more over each calendar month. NUIT shall provide a 15-minute response time and a 2-hour target resolution time for all incidents or requests received from deans, directors, chairs, and their designated assistants, with a compliance target of 90% or higher over each calendar month.
results.justification: This clause defines specific targets for incident response and resolution times, categorizing it as a Service Levels clause. While it outlines performance expectations and different priority levels, including elevated commitments for specific stakeholders, its legal enforceability is severely compromised by the use of aspirational language such as 'NUIT aims to meet these targets' and 'We expect to provide'. Such phrasing does not establish a firm contractual obligation, rendering the service level commitments non-binding. More critically, the clause completely omits any mention of remedies, service credits, or other consequences for the service provider's failure to meet these stated targets. This absence means the service recipient has no contractual mechanism to enforce the service levels or to seek redress for non-performance. This creates a significant imbalance in obligations, as the provider merely states intentions without accepting clear liability, while the recipient relies on these intentions without contractual assurance. The clause therefore presents a high risk due to fundamental enforceability gaps and exposes the service recipient to significant operational and commercial risks without adequate contractual protection.

results.clause_text: Request Priority Response Time Resolution Time High 1 Business Hour 1 Business day Medium, 4 Business Hours 3 Business days Low 8 Business Hours 5 Business days NUIT aims to meet these targets 80% or more over a period of calendar month.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: If this clause is ignored, the client faces significant commercial and operational exposure. The aspirational language 'aims to meet' renders the service level commitments non-binding, meaning NUIT has no firm contractual obligation to adhere to the stated response and resolution times. Consequently, the client would have no legal recourse or compensatory mechanisms (such as service credits or damages) if NUIT consistently fails to meet these targets, even falling below the 80% threshold. This leaves the client vulnerable to prolonged service disruptions, potential financial losses due to operational impact, and reputational damage, all without contractual remedy. The entire risk of service underperformance is effectively borne by the client, creating a significant imbalance of obligations.
results.suggested_correction: NUIT shall provide services according to the following priority response and resolution times: High priority requests shall have a Response Time of 1 Business Hour and a Resolution Time of 1 Business Day. Medium priority requests shall have a Response Time of 4 Business Hours and a Resolution Time of 3 Business Days. Low priority requests shall have a Response Time of 8 Business Hours and a Resolution Time of 5 Business Days. NUIT shall meet these targets for at least 80% of all requests over each calendar month.
results.justification: The clause is correctly identified as a Service Levels clause, as it outlines specific performance metrics for response and resolution times based on request priority. However, the clause contains a critical drafting weakness that renders its core commitments largely unenforceable. The phrase 'NUIT aims to meet these targets' makes the service levels aspirational rather than contractually binding obligations. This language transforms what should be firm commitments into mere statements of intent, severely undermining the legal enforceability of the entire service level framework. As a direct consequence, the client lacks a contractual basis to compel performance at the stated levels or to seek remedies for underperformance. The absence of any specified consequences, penalties, or service credits for failure to meet even these aspirational targets further exacerbates the commercial risk. The client would have no compensatory mechanism for potential business disruptions or losses resulting from NUIT's consistent failure to adhere to the defined service levels. This creates a significant imbalance of obligations, as the client bears all the risk associated with service underperformance while NUIT has minimal contractual liability. Given these fundamental enforceability gaps and the high commercial and operational exposure for the client due to the lack of binding commitments and specified remedies, the clause carries a high risk score of 8.0.

results.clause_text: NUIT Service Desk function will aim to meet the following target conditions for key performance metrics. • 80% of calls answered or abandoned within 30 seconds (Service Level) Average • Speed of Answer: 30 seconds or less • Abandon Rate: 5-8% • First call resolution rate: 65% • Customer satisfaction rate: 85%
results.business_risk_if_ignored: If this clause remains uncorrected, the business relying on these service levels faces substantial operational and financial exposure. The aspirational language ("will aim to meet") means that the service provider has no binding obligation to achieve the stated performance targets, rendering the service levels effectively unenforceable. Consequently, the business would have no contractual basis to compel performance or claim a breach if the service desk consistently underperforms, even significantly. This could lead to prolonged customer dissatisfaction, reputational damage, operational inefficiencies, and potential revenue loss, all without any clear path for recourse or compensation. The absence of specified remedies or consequences for non-performance leaves the business vulnerable to prolonged poor service, incurring costs and disruptions without the ability to enforce the expected service quality.
results.suggested_correction: The NUIT Service Desk function shall meet the following target conditions for key performance metrics. Failure to achieve any of these targets shall constitute a Service Level breach. • 80% of calls answered or abandoned within 30 seconds (Service Level) Average • Speed of Answer: 30 seconds or less • Abandon Rate: 5-8% • First call resolution rate: 65% • Customer satisfaction rate: 85%
results.justification: The clause, while clearly defining key performance metrics for the NUIT Service Desk, contains a critical legal weakness in its use of the phrase "will aim to meet." This language transforms what should be a binding contractual obligation into a mere aspirational goal or objective, significantly undermining the enforceability of these performance standards. For the party relying on these service levels, this means there is no firm contractual assurance of performance, as the service provider is merely "aiming" to achieve them, not legally committing to do so. This absence of a clear, enforceable commitment creates a profound imbalance of obligations, heavily favoring the service provider. Furthermore, the clause entirely omits any provisions for remedies, service credits, or other specified consequences for failure to meet even these aspirational targets. This lack of any mechanism to address underperformance exacerbates the enforceability issue, leaving the aggrieved party without a clear contractual basis to claim breach or seek recourse for inadequate service. Consequently, the clause presents significant enforceability gaps and high commercial exposure, as the stated service levels are effectively unenforceable, risking operational disruption and potential financial loss without any contractual remedy. This warrants a high-risk assessment, reflecting the substantial legal and commercial vulnerabilities it introduces.

results.clause_text: In the event of an ongoing service level breach, NUIT will perform a root cause analysis and present options to review and determine appropriate steps to mitigate, which could include increasing staffing levels, process adjustments, or other remediation steps.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: Ignoring the current drafting weaknesses exposes the Client to significant commercial and operational risks. An ongoing service level breach could persist without clear and binding remediation commitments from NUIT. The vagueness regarding who determines the 'appropriate steps' and NUIT's obligation to implement them creates uncertainty and potential for prolonged service disruption. Without defined timeframes for analysis and implementation, the Client lacks leverage to compel timely resolution, leading to potential financial losses, reputational damage, and operational inefficiencies due to unreliable service. The absence of specific remedies further exacerbates the Client's exposure, as they would have limited recourse to mitigate the impact of continued non-performance.
results.suggested_correction: In the event of an ongoing service level breach, NUIT shall promptly perform a root cause analysis and propose to the Client a remediation plan detailing specific steps to mitigate the breach, which shall include, for example, increasing staffing levels or process adjustments, along with a timeline for implementation. NUIT shall then promptly implement the agreed-upon remediation plan to resolve the ongoing service level breach.
results.justification: This clause falls under the 'Service Levels' category as it outlines actions to address service performance failures. While it establishes a process for root cause analysis and proposes mitigation options, it presents significant enforceability gaps and an imbalance of obligations, leading to a moderate risk score. The primary weaknesses stem from the clause's lack of specificity and firm commitments. The phrasing 'will perform... and present options to review and determine appropriate steps' is inherently vague, failing to clearly define NUIT's binding obligation to resolve the breach or the Client's authority in approving and mandating specific remedial actions. The term 'could include' renders the suggested mitigation steps illustrative rather than mandatory components of a resolution plan. Crucially, the clause lacks defined timeframes for completing the root cause analysis, presenting a plan, or implementing solutions, which allows for potential delays. Moreover, the absence of any explicit commitment for NUIT to actually implement agreed-upon steps, or any specific remedies or penalties for an 'ongoing service level breach,' leaves the Client commercially exposed. This imbalance places the burden of continued service degradation on the Client without guaranteed and timely resolution, as NUIT's obligation is largely limited to analysis and proposing options, rather than compelling the breach's cessation. The reconciled risk score of 6.0 reflects these significant enforceability gaps and the imbalance of obligations, indicating that while a process is described, its practical utility for the Client in compelling resolution of ongoing breaches is severely limited without clearer, more binding terms and timelines.

results.clause_text: During periods of multiple simultaneous service requests, NUIT will allocate resources in accordance with the following criteria: 1. High impact services (Mission Critical) 2. High volume services 3. Production services (opposed to training, quality assurance, test, development) 4. Time sensitive services 5. Other services
results.business_risk_if_ignored: If this clause is ignored, NUIT would retain unilateral authority to define and apply the service prioritization criteria. This presents significant commercial exposure for the client, as their mission-critical or time-sensitive services could be consistently deprioritized during periods of high demand without their input or recourse. Such deprioritization could lead to service degradation, operational disruptions, reputational damage, and potential financial losses for the client, without any contractual remedies or agreed-upon service levels to mitigate these impacts. The inherent ambiguity in how criteria like 'High impact' or 'Time sensitive' are defined and applied by NUIT further increases the likelihood of disputes regarding service delivery expectations and performance.
results.suggested_correction: During periods of multiple simultaneous service requests, NUIT shall allocate resources in accordance with the following criteria, the specific definitions and prioritization of which shall be agreed by the Parties: 1. High impact services (Mission Critical) 2. High volume services 3. Production services (opposed to training, quality assurance, test, development) 4. Time sensitive services 5. Other services
results.justification: This clause establishes NUIT's internal prioritization mechanism for allocating resources during times of high demand, thereby directly impacting the level of service delivered to clients. It is appropriately classified as pertaining to Service Levels due to its direct influence on service performance and delivery. The primary weakness lies in its unilateral nature: the criteria are stated by NUIT without explicit provision for client input or mutual agreement on the definitions or application of these priorities. This creates an imbalance of obligations where NUIT dictates resource allocation, potentially at the client's commercial detriment. Commercial exposure arises because a client's services, even if deemed critical to their operations, might consistently fall into lower priority tiers according to NUIT's internal interpretation, leading to service degradation or delays without agreed-upon remedies or service credits. While the criteria themselves provide a framework, the subjective interpretation of terms like 'High impact' or 'Time sensitive' by NUIT without a mutual definition process can lead to ambiguity in application and potential disputes over actual service performance. The clause does not provide any mechanisms for client consultation, review of prioritization decisions, or remedies for impacts suffered due to deprioritization. The reconciled risk score of 4.0 reflects a moderate level of exposure, acknowledging that while a prioritization structure is necessary for operational efficiency, the current drafting introduces an undesirable commercial imbalance and potential for disputes due to its unilateral and potentially ambiguous application, which could materially affect the client's business operations.

results.clause_text: This Agreement represents the entire agreement between the customer and NUIT and supersedes all prior negotiations or agreements, written or oral, which are not included herein. This Agreement may only be amended by written instructions executed by the customer and NUIT. Either party may end this agreement by providing 90 days written notice. All customer assets, in the form of data or otherwise, related to this agreement must be obtained by the customer before or on the date of termination.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: If this clause is ignored, the primary business risk lies with the customer regarding the timely retrieval of their assets. Failure to retrieve all customer data and other related assets by the specified termination date could lead to permanent data loss, causing significant operational disruption, financial loss, and potential regulatory non-compliance for the customer. Although the clause places responsibility clearly on the customer, NUIT could face indirect reputational damage if a customer experiences such a loss. For NUIT, ignoring the entire agreement and amendment provisions could lead to disputes over the agreed terms or the validity of informal contractual changes, potentially undermining the enforceability of the written agreement.
results.suggested_correction: This Agreement represents the entire agreement between the customer and NUIT and supersedes all prior negotiations or agreements, written or oral, which are not included herein. This Agreement may only be amended by written instructions executed by the customer and NUIT. Either party may terminate this Agreement by providing 90 days written notice. Customer shall retrieve all Customer Data and other Customer assets related to this Agreement on or before the effective date of termination.
results.justification: This clause is primarily classified as a 'Term and Termination' clause due to its provisions governing the ending of the agreement and the obligations upon termination, despite also containing standard 'Entire Agreement' and 'Amendment' boilerplate language. The 'Entire Agreement' and 'Amendment' sections are legally sound and enforce contract integrity, ensuring that only written and executed terms form part of the agreement and that changes are formalised. The termination provision, allowing either party to end the agreement with 90 days' written notice, is a common and balanced commercial term, providing a reasonable transition period for both parties without creating undue burden or significant exposure. The requirement for the customer to obtain all assets, specifically data, on or before the date of termination clearly places the responsibility for data retrieval on the customer. While this necessitates careful operational planning by the customer to avoid data loss, the clause itself is clear and enforceable in allocating this obligation. There is no inherent imbalance in the obligations as the termination right is mutual, and the data retrieval responsibility aligns with standard practices for customer-owned data in a service context. The clause's drafting is largely standard and functional, with minor areas for linguistic precision rather than fundamental enforceability gaps. Consequently, the overall risk is assessed as low (3.0), reflecting minor drafting opportunities to enhance clarity without altering the core commercial intent or risk allocation.

results.clause_text: Support under this agreement is recognized as a cooperative effort between customer, and Northwestern IT. The expertise Northwestern IT is providing is support for only the items outlined in this agreement. Should the customer determine there is a need for support for any items not specifically outlined in this agreement; the following procedure should be followed: A request should be made, in writing or in electronic form, to NUIT outlining the service requested. Note: requests for additional services should not be made to support personnel on site. Northwestern IT will create a proposal to deliver the service, detailing any new fees if incremental staff or services are required, and forward it to customer for review. Once approved by customer the proposal will be set forth as an addendum to this Agreement or as a new agreement if the requested services are foreign to the intentions of this Agreement.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: If the established process for requesting and approving additional services is ignored, Northwestern IT faces significant scope creep, uncompensated work, and potential disputes over service expectations and charges. Conversely, the Customer risks not receiving necessary support for unoutlined items, delays in service provision, and unclear financial obligations for expanded services. Without the formal process, there is a risk of miscommunication, unauthorized work, and an inability to correctly bill for or decline services outside the original scope, leading to financial loss or customer dissatisfaction.
results.suggested_correction: Northwestern IT's support services are strictly limited to the items expressly outlined in this Agreement. If Customer requests support for any items not expressly outlined in this Agreement, the following procedure shall apply: Customer shall submit a written or electronic request to Northwestern IT detailing the requested service. Requests for additional services shall not be made to on-site support personnel. Northwestern IT shall prepare and submit to Customer a proposal for such service, detailing any new fees if incremental staff or services are required. Upon Customer's written approval, the proposal shall be formalized as an Addendum to this Agreement or as a new agreement, depending on the nature and scope of the requested services.
results.justification: The clause precisely defines the scope of Northwestern IT's support services, limiting them to items expressly detailed within the agreement. Critically, it establishes a formal, multi-step change control process for customer requests concerning any services not initially covered. This process mandates a written or electronic request from the customer, prohibits direct requests to on-site personnel, requires Northwestern IT to provide a detailed proposal outlining any new fees or staffing requirements, and necessitates formalization via an Addendum or new agreement upon customer approval. This structure effectively manages expectations for both parties by clearly demarcating included services and providing a robust mechanism for addressing scope expansion. The clause is balanced, as it protects Northwestern IT from scope creep and uncompensated work while providing a clear pathway for the customer to procure additional services under defined terms. The risks are minimal and well-controlled through the established procedure, making the clause highly enforceable and commercially sound. The reconciled risk score of 2.5 reflects a low exposure, primarily addressing minor semantic refinements rather than fundamental enforceability or commercial exposure issues, as the core process is robust.

results.clause_text: Customer (Major Administration Unit): Fiscal Officer: Phone number: Email: Account: Sub Account:
results.justification: All models agree this clause is not a golden clause.

results.clause_text: The below cost model only applies if there is not an existing Memorandum of Understanding. If a signed MOU exists please refer to that for the cost of agreement. Workstations: $525/year Mobile Devices $525/year Printers: No Charge (Limit one printer per workstation) Multi-function Devices: No Charge (Limit one multi-function device per workstation) Devices added mid-year prorated based upon applicable annual service charge for device.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: If the identified weaknesses are ignored, the clause creates significant commercial exposure for both parties. For the service provider, the absence of clear invoicing schedules, payment due dates, and provisions for late payments can lead to delayed revenue recognition, cash flow uncertainty, and increased administrative burden in pursuing outstanding amounts. For the client, the ambiguity surrounding payment obligations can result in disputes, unexpected liabilities, and a lack of financial predictability. Furthermore, the conditional application of this cost model based on the existence of an external Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) introduces a critical point of potential conflict and unenforceability. If the MOU is not readily accessible, clear, or consistent with other agreement terms, the foundational cost structure becomes uncertain, making it challenging to accurately bill or verify charges. This fundamental lack of clarity in payment mechanics and the dependency on an external, potentially unspecified document increase the risk of legal disputes, damaged business relationships, and operational inefficiencies.
results.suggested_correction: Unless a separate, fully executed Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) explicitly governing the costs for services under this Agreement is in effect, the following cost model shall apply. The annual service charges are: Workstations: $525/year; Mobile Devices: $525/year. Printers: No Charge (limited to one printer per workstation). Multi-function Devices: No Charge (limited to one multi-function device per workstation). Devices added mid-year shall be prorated based upon the applicable annual service charge for the device from the date of addition. Invoices for charges incurred hereunder shall be issued monthly in arrears and are due and payable within thirty (30) days of receipt. Any amounts not paid when due shall accrue interest at a rate of one and a half percent (1.5%) per month or the maximum rate permitted by law, whichever is less, from the due date until paid.
results.justification: The clause clearly defines specific annual service charges for workstations and mobile devices, along with 'no charge' provisions for printers and multi-function devices subject to specified limits, and includes a methodology for prorating charges for devices added mid-year. This aspect of the clause effectively establishes certain pricing components. However, the clause introduces significant enforceability risks and commercial exposure by making the entire cost model conditional upon the non-existence of an external Memorandum of Understanding (MOU), without sufficiently clarifying the terms under which an MOU would supersede or the process for resolving potential conflicts if one exists. This dependency on an external, potentially unspecified document can lead to ambiguity and disputes regarding the applicable cost structure. More critically, the clause, in isolation, is incomplete as a comprehensive 'Payment Terms' provision. It entirely omits fundamental operational details essential for financial clarity and predictability, such as explicit invoicing triggers, defined payment due dates, and provisions for interest on delayed payments. These omissions create substantial commercial exposure, as they leave crucial aspects of the payment cycle undefined, increasing the likelihood of payment disputes, cash flow uncertainty, and administrative burdens. While the specific costs mentioned are clear, the lack of a complete payment framework and the ambiguity introduced by the external MOU dependency constitute significant drafting weaknesses. The reconciled risk score of 5.0 reflects this moderate ambiguity and limited exposure, acknowledging the clarity of specific pricing elements while highlighting the critical gaps in payment mechanics and the enforceability concerns arising from the external document dependency that could lead to operational and financial disruption.

contract_text:
Service Level Agreement
and
Northwestern IT
Contents
1.0 Service Level Agreement Overview ................................................................................................... 3
2.0 Business Service Description ............................................................................................................. 3
3.0 Agreement Period .............................................................................................................................. 4
4.0 Maintenance ...................................................................................................................................... 4
5.0 Northwestern IT Responsibilities ....................................................................................................... 4
6.0 Customer Responsibilities .................................................................................................................. 8
7.0 Assumptions ...................................................................................................................................... 9
8.0 Requesting Support ........................................................................................................................... 9
8.1 Incident Response and Resolution Times.......................................................................................... 10
8.2 Service Request Response and Resolution Times .............................................................................. 10
8.4 Service Desk Metrics ........................................................................................................................ 11
8.6 Ongoing breach in service level ........................................................................................................ 11
9.0 Priority of service requests ............................................................................................................... 11
10.0 Amendments or Termination.......................................................................................................... 11
11.0 Support Outside of this Agreement ................................................................................................. 12
12.0 Billing Information ........................................................................................................................ 12
13.0 Cost of Agreement ..................................................................................................................................... 12
1.0 Service Level Agreement Overview
This document is a Service Level Agreement between Northwestern IT (service provider)
and the (customer), outlining the provisioning of IT services.
The purpose of this agreement is to establish service expectations, identify provider and
consumer responsibilities related to this service, specify how this service is supported, and
clarify service charges.
2.0 Business Service Description
Northwestern IT (NUIT) agrees to provide Endpoint device management and support as a
service to customer.
NUIT will: provide
• Device deployment – Procurement, Custom factory image loading including
enterprise licensed common applications, asset tagging and labelling, pre-delivery
and staging services, and system installation, system configuration and data
migrations. Delivers and installs your fully integrated systems to customer
designated user locations.
• Secure endpoint management - pre-configuration of security solutions and
installation of antivirus, data encryption and data backup solutions. Regular
application of Operating system and application software patches.
• Device Management - Agent monitoring to ensure proper tracking of device
lifecycle
• NUIT Service Desk - represents the entry point and first-touch support process for
all hardware and software service-related requests. NUIT delivers a strategic,
customized full-featured service desk that is driven by the goals of quality, value,
and customer satisfaction. NUIT service desk is accountable to resolve, track,
escalate and follow-up on all Endpoint systems related issues that affect customer
productivity.
• NUIT provides on-site Field Services support for endpoint systems, software, and
peripherals support. We assist with installations, moves, adds and changes, as well
as everyday hardware and peripheral support services.
Authorized service delivery providers will be dispatched to your End User when
hardware, software, or peripheral problems cannot be resolved remotely.
• Disposition and redeployment– NUIT delivers efficient, secure and simple
processes for data recoveries to disposals and refreshes. Ensures that system data
is destroyed for security purposes. Disposal of Assets and manages Employee
Purchase Programs.
3.0 Agreement Period
The period of this agreement is September 1, 2019 through August 30, 2020. Each year,
this agreement will automatically extend for one calendar year unless it is modified or
terminated as described in this document.
4.0 Maintenance
Maintenance of services provided in this agreement will be conducted in accordance with
established NUIT Change Management practices, and will occur during scheduled service
maintenance windows. Emergency maintenance, in response to service outages, may
occur with no advanced notice to service consumers. Maintenance or outages of other,
underlying or integrated, services may impact the services provided in this agreement.
Notification of service maintenance and outages is available at:
Service Status (https://service-status.northwestern.edu/).
Information on how to subscribe to email service alerts can be found at:
https://service-status.northwestern.edu/
5.0 Northwestern IT Responsibilities
The following list specifies responsibilities of NUIT related to providing the service set
forth in this agreement. Northwestern IT will be responsible for the following:
Workstations (desktop and laptop computers)
• Build workstations
Install one of NUIT approved computer images
o
 Dual booting or machines with multiple operating systems will be
assessed and approved by the Technology Support Services Director on
a case by case basis based on business, research or teaching need.
Install additional software and or make additional updates to the endpoint
o
device
 Upon request
 Subject to security approval
Include and manage
o
 NUIT’ service automated software updating services (Kace/ JAMF)
 Endpoint security software(Symantec Endpoint Protection)
 Whole disk encryption (MBAM and FileVault)
Ensure desired work space has functional electrical and network access
o
 Make recommendations for electrical or network access and advise
CONDUITS and FM ordering processes.
Purchase, deliver and install workstation in desired work space
o
Troubleshooting wired or wireless network connectivity users, escalating to
o
TNS has required.
• Address user observed errors upon notification
Conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts
o
Coordinate warranty work as required
o
 Coordinate with Dell, Lenovo/CDWG for services (PCs)
 Coordinate with Apple service technician (MACs)
Provide temporary loaner computer
o
 Upon request
 If operationally necessary
 Subject to availability
Conference room and classroom support
o
 Coordinate with Northwestern IT Audio/Visual team as need for
support issue
• Provide departmental fiscal office with semi-annual refresh notifications for
workstations.
• Assist with providing purchasing recommendations for new or replacement computers
• Provide major OS updates as required for vendor support (e.g. Windows “Creator
Updates”, MacOS 10.X point releases)
• Provide disposition of end-of-life devices
Scrub data and remove hard drive
o
Send devices to Northwestern University Surplus and/or donate to Student
o
Enrichment Services
Mobile Devices
The following support is offered upon request:
• Make purchasing recommendations for Northwestern University owned mobile device
• Configure mobile devise
• Configure email
• Coordinate activities with 3rd party vendors as required (University owned devices
only)
• Address user observed errors upon notification
Conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts
o
Coordinate warranty work as required (University owned devices only)
o
Printers
The following support is offered upon request:
• Set up printers
• Organize for disposal of printers
OU Administration (CampusAD)
The following support is offered upon request:
• Add new users to CampusAD
• Create CampusAD accounts
• Grant access to resources control via CampusAD
• Delete users
• Manage Group Policies
Endpoint Management Services
Management of the following endpoint management software’s:
• Workstations will be patched no less than monthly for OS and application by use of
management software, including Kace, JAMF
• Full system backup of device including local machine stored data using Crashplan
Monitoring of backup services will be provided, with either tickets generated
o
or user notification provided in the event that backups are not functioning
Box
The following support is offered upon request:
• Install Box client software, such as Box Edit, Drive and Sync
• Facilitate the creation of organization shares and group accounts
Multi-function devices
The following support is offered upon request:
• Configure printing and scanning access to a multi-function device.
• Address user observed errors upon notification
Conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts
o
Coordinate warranty work as required
o
Installation and Troubleshooting of customer specific software
The following support is offered upon request:
• Northwestern IT will install all customer specific software and will work with the
user/experts in said software to ensure that the installation of these applications does not
destabilize other desktop or application functionality
• NUIT will work with the user/experts to contact the vendor of said software to
accomplish same, but will not act independently of the user/experts in contacting
vendors.
Out of Scope
The following services are explicitly not offered in this SLA.
